alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 1:53PM EDT until May 04 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Middle Branch Escanaba River at Humboldt affecting Marquette County. Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall continue. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, 3500 - cfs - River exceeds bankfull stage * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:10 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 5.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.9 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1000 PM EDT /900 PM CDT/.
